content: कषाय {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Astringent; <ls>Ś. 2.</ls> {@--2@} Fragrant; स्फुटितकमलामोदमैत्रीकषायः <ls>Me. 31</ls>; <ls>U. 2. 21</ls>; <ls>Mv. 5. 41.</ls> {@--3@} Red, dark-red; चूतांकुरास्वादकषायकंठः <ls>Ku. 3. 32.</ls> {@--4@} (Hence) Sweet-sounding; <ls>Māl. 7.</ls> {@--5@} Brown. {@--6@} Improper, dirty. --यः, --यं {@--1@} Astringent flavour or taste (one of the six {%rasas%}): see कटु; यो वक्त्रं परिशोषयति जिह्वां स्तंभयति कंठं बध्नाति हृदयं कषति पीडयति च स कषायः <ls>Suśr.</ls> {@--2@} The red colour. {@--3@} A decoction with one part of a drug mixed with four, eight, or sixteen parts of water (the whole being boiled down until one quarter is left); <ls>Ms. 11. 154.</ls> {@--4@} Plastering, smearing; <ls>Ku. 7. 17</ls>; anointing. {@--5@} Perfuming the body with unguents; <ls>Rs. 1. 4.</ls> {@--6@} Gum, resin, extract or exudation from a tree. {@--7@} Dirt, uncleanness. {@--8@} Dulness, stupidity. {@--9@} Attachment to worldly objects. {@--10@} Decay, ruin. --यः {@--1@} Passion, emotion. {@--2@} Kali yuga.
